Description:
**1. Basic Company Information:**

- **Company Name:** Coinbase Global, Inc.
- **Founding Year:** 2012

- **Headquarters Location:** Coinbase operates as a remote-first company and does not have a formal headquarters. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))
- **Founders:** Brian Armstrong and Fred Ehrsam

- **Ownership Background:** Coinbase is a publicly traded company listed on NASDAQ under the ticker symbol COIN. ([investor.coinbase.com](https://investor.coinbase.com/home/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
- **Official Homepage URL:** [https://www.coinbase.com](https://www.coinbase.com)

**2. Products and Technology:**

- **Core Products & Services:**
 - **Coinbase App:** A platform for buying, storing, and trading various cryptocurrencies.
 - **Coinbase One:** A subscription-based plan offering premium features and services.
 - **Coinbase Advanced:** A professional trading platform for digital assets.
 - **Coinbase Wallet:** An application enabling access to decentralized crypto applications (dApps).
 - **USD Coin (USDC):** A stablecoin issued by Circle Internet Financial, with Coinbase holding an equity stake.
 - **Coinbase Card:** A Visa debit card allowing cryptocurrency spending.
 - **Coinbase Earn:** A staking service where users can earn rewards by participating in blockchain transaction validation. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

- **Underlying Technologies:** Coinbase's platforms are built on secure, scalable, and reliable technologies to support cryptocurrency transactions and storage.

**3. Market and Customer Information:**

- **Customer Types:** Coinbase serves both retail investors (B2C) and institutional clients (B2B).
- **Industries Served:** Primarily focuses on the cryptocurrency and financial technology sectors.

- **Geographic Markets:** Operates in over 100 countries worldwide. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

**4. Financial and HR Details:**

- **Revenue History:**
 - **2024:** $6.565 billion
 - **2023:** $3.108 billion
 - **2022:** $3.194 billion
 - **2021:** $7.839 billion
 - **2020:** $1.277 billion
 - **2019:** $534 million ([macrotrends.net](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/COIN/coinbase-global/revenue?utm_source=openai))

- **Funding Rounds:** Specific details on funding rounds are not provided in the available sources.
- **Employee Count:** As of December 31, 2024, Coinbase had over 3,700 employees. ([investor.coinbase.com](https://investor.coinbase.com/home/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

**5. Strategic Information:**

- **Major Clients or Case Studies:** Specific major clients or case studies are not detailed in the available sources.
- **Strategic Initiatives:**
 - In May 2025, Coinbase announced plans to open a 58,600-square-foot office in Charlotte, North Carolina, serving as a "Center of Excellence" for compliance and customer support teams. ([axios.com](https://www.axios.com/local/charlotte/2025/06/03/coinbase-110-east-south-end-crypto-jobs-fintech?utm_source=openai))
 - In May 2025, Coinbase was added to the S&P 500 index, becoming the first cryptocurrency firm to achieve this milestone. ([cincodias.elpais.com](https://cincodias.elpais.com/criptoactivos/2025-05-13/el-mercado-coinbase-se-convierte-en-la-primera-firma-cripto-que-entra-en-el-indice-sp-500.html?utm_source=openai))

- **Key Competitors:** Other major cryptocurrency exchanges such as Binance, Kraken, and Gemini.
- **Overall Summary:** Coinbase has solidified its position as a leading cryptocurrency exchange, expanding its services and geographic reach. The company's inclusion in the S&P 500 and strategic expansions indicate a strong market presence and growth trajectory.

**6. Additional Business Information:**

- **Professional Open Positions:** As of June 2025, Coinbase is actively hiring over 130 positions for its compliance and customer support teams in Charlotte, North Carolina. ([axios.com](https://www.axios.com/local/charlotte/2025/06/03/coinbase-110-east-south-end-crypto-jobs-fintech?utm_source=openai))
- **Working Languages:** The primary language used for business communications and documentation is English.

**7. Technical and Compliance Information:**

- **User Portal/Login System:** Coinbase offers a user-facing platform accessible via its website and mobile applications, where users can create accounts, manage portfolios, and conduct cryptocurrency transactions.
- **Compliance Standards:** Coinbase adheres to various regulatory standards, including Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) requirements. The company has also obtained licenses such as the BitLicense from the New York State Department of Financial Services. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

**Sources:**

- [Coinbase Investor Relations](https://investor.coinbase.com/home/default.aspx)
- [Coinbase Wikipedia Page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase)

- [Coinbase Global Revenue 2020-2024 | COIN | MacroTrends](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/COIN/coinbase-global/revenue)
- [Coinbase to open office in 110 East](https://www.axios.com/local/charlotte/2025/06/03/coinbase-110-east-south-end-crypto-jobs-fintech)

- [The Coinbase market becomes the first crypto firm to enter the S&P 500 index](https://cincodias.elpais.com/criptoactivos/2025-05-13/el-mercado-coinbase-se-convierte-en-la-primera-firma-cripto-que-entra-en-el-indice-sp-500.html)

detailed_criteria.criteria_text: The company does not have headquarters in Mainlaind China, Iran or Russia.

mandatory_criteria.criteria_text: Company offers personalized, real-time, or automated digital services as a core feature

detailed_criteria.criteria_text: Mentions fast iteration, innovation, or scaling of digital services
References using customer behavior or data insights to enhance services

Qualified_Products:
QUALIFIED: Data-First Innovators
NTH Score: 1.000
Total NTH Criteria: 2
Passed: 2
ND (No Data): 0

The company has also obtained licenses such as the BitLicense from the New York State Department of Financial Services. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

Description:
**1. Basic Company Information:**

- **Company Name:** Coinbase Global, Inc.
- **Founding Year:** 2012

- **Headquarters Location:** Coinbase operates as a remote-first company and does not have a formal headquarters. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))
- **Founders:** Brian Armstrong and Fred Ehrsam

- **Ownership Background:** Coinbase is a publicly traded company listed on NASDAQ under the ticker symbol COIN. ([investor.coinbase.com](https://investor.coinbase.com/home/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))
- **Official Homepage URL:** [https://www.coinbase.com](https://www.coinbase.com)

**2. Products and Technology:**

- **Core Products & Services:**
 - **Coinbase App:** A platform for buying, storing, and trading various cryptocurrencies.
 - **Coinbase One:** A subscription-based plan offering premium features and services.
 - **Coinbase Advanced:** A professional trading platform for digital assets.
 - **Coinbase Wallet:** An application enabling access to decentralized crypto applications (dApps).
 - **USD Coin (USDC):** A stablecoin issued by Circle Internet Financial, with Coinbase holding an equity stake.
 - **Coinbase Card:** A Visa debit card allowing cryptocurrency spending.
 - **Coinbase Earn:** A staking service where users can earn rewards by participating in blockchain transaction validation. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

- **Underlying Technologies:** Coinbase's platforms are built on secure, scalable, and reliable technologies to support cryptocurrency transactions and storage.

**3. Market and Customer Information:**

- **Customer Types:** Coinbase serves both retail investors (B2C) and institutional clients (B2B).
- **Industries Served:** Primarily focuses on the cryptocurrency and financial technology sectors.

- **Geographic Markets:** Operates in over 100 countries worldwide. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))

**4. Financial and HR Details:**

- **Revenue History:**
 - **2024:** $6.565 billion
 - **2023:** $3.108 billion
 - **2022:** $3.194 billion
 - **2021:** $7.839 billion
 - **2020:** $1.277 billion
 - **2019:** $534 million ([macrotrends.net](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/COIN/coinbase-global/revenue?utm_source=openai))

- **Funding Rounds:** Specific details on funding rounds are not provided in the available sources.
- **Employee Count:** As of December 31, 2024, Coinbase had over 3,700 employees. ([investor.coinbase.com](https://investor.coinbase.com/home/default.aspx?utm_source=openai))

**5. Strategic Information:**

- **Major Clients or Case Studies:** Specific major clients or case studies are not detailed in the available sources.
- **Strategic Initiatives:**
 - In May 2025, Coinbase announced plans to open a 58,600-square-foot office in Charlotte, North Carolina, serving as a "Center of Excellence" for compliance and customer support teams. ([axios.com](https://www.axios.com/local/charlotte/2025/06/03/coinbase-110-east-south-end-crypto-jobs-fintech?utm_source=openai))
 - In May 2025, Coinbase was added to the S&P 500 index, becoming the first cryptocurrency firm to achieve this milestone. ([cincodias.elpais.com](https://cincodias.elpais.com/criptoactivos/2025-05-13/el-mercado-coinbase-se-convierte-en-la-primera-firma-cripto-que-entra-en-el-indice-sp-500.html?utm_source=openai))

- **Key Competitors:** Other major cryptocurrency exchanges such as Binance, Kraken, and Gemini.
- **Overall Summary:** Coinbase has solidified its position as a leading cryptocurrency exchange, expanding its services and geographic reach. The company's inclusion in the S&P 500 and strategic expansions indicate a strong market presence and growth trajectory.

**6. Additional Business Information:**

- **Professional Open Positions:** As of June 2025, Coinbase is actively hiring over 130 positions for its compliance and customer support teams in Charlotte, North Carolina. ([axios.com](https://www.axios.com/local/charlotte/2025/06/03/coinbase-110-east-south-end-crypto-jobs-fintech?utm_source=openai))
- **Working Languages:** The primary language used for business communications and documentation is English.

**7. Technical and Compliance Information:**

- **User Portal/Login System:** Coinbase offers a user-facing platform accessible via its website and mobile applications, where users can create accounts, manage portfolios, and conduct cryptocurrency transactions.
- **Compliance Standards:** Coinbase adheres to various regulatory standards, including Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) requirements. The company has also obtained licenses such as the BitLicense from the New York State Department of Financial Services. ([en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coinbase?utm_source=openai))
